intro: Parahellenia tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin parahellenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Parahellenia tonkinensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
